definition: vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused

sentences.english: The light of the setting sun suffused the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 落日余晖离开了峰顶，谷内暮色苍茫。

sentences.english: In the boundless twilight, this herd of beautiful creatures are silhouetted by the rays of evening sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 暮色苍茫中，这一群美生灵被霞光勾勒出一片剪影。

sentences.english: We listened to a rich voice which rolled out into the dusk.
sentences.chinese: 我们静听暮色苍茫中响起的一个圆润洪亮的声音。

sentences.english: Velvet black shadows emphasize their brilliance, while the depths of the canyon are flooded by an ocean of vermilion dusk.
sentences.chinese: 而大峡谷的深处正沐浴在一派朱红的暮色苍茫中。

sentences.english: See the deepening twilight, Jinsong, Cloud Flying is still calm.
sentences.chinese: 暮色苍茫看劲松，乱云飞渡仍从容。

sentences.english: I was going through Lombaed Street in the dusk of the evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天傍晚暮色苍茫的时候，我正走在郎巴德街上。

sentences.english: Eliza made her desperate retreat across the river just in the dusk of twilight.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽萨奋不顾身地逃过那条河，正是暮色苍茫时分。

sentences.english: She often sits in the garden at twilight.
sentences.chinese: 她经常在暮色苍茫时坐在花园里。

definition: the sun sets in the west (idiom)
night scene/the dim light of night
